meanings.definition: A raid or incursion, especially one carried out by a group of people.
meanings.sent1: The razzia by the bandits left the village in chaos.
meanings.sent2: The military conducted a razzia on the enemy camp.
meanings.sent3: During the razzia, the thieves accidentally stole a cake instead of valuables.
meanings.sent4: The razzia of tourists into the small town overwhelmed the locals.
meanings.sent5: The razzia of seagulls on the picnic food was swift and unexpected.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden raid or incursion.
meanings.sent1: The rebels decided to razzia the enemy outpost under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent2: The burglars planned to razzia the jewelry store when it was least guarded.
meanings.sent3: The kids thought it would be fun to razzia the cookie jar before dinner.
meanings.sent4: The virus seemed to razzia the computer system, causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds began to razzia the peaceful sky, bringing thunder and lightning.
